organization.fullName: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

identificationModule.briefTitle: Clears On the Day of Anesthesia Permissible up to One-Hour Prior (CODA-POP) to Surgery
identificationModule.officialTitle: CODA-POP Surgery: Clears On the Day of Anesthesia Permissible up to One-Hour Prior to Surgery - A Prospective Randomized and Blind Trial

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

leadSponsor.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The purpose of this study is to assess whether residual gastric volumes in patients who receive clear liquids one hour prior to time of procedure is non-inferior compared to patients who are NPO past midnight, to compare efficiency and flexibility of operating room scheduling between two fasting conditions, to assess patient satisfaction and post-operative nausea, vomiting, pain, hunger and thirst.

and to assess wound healing and post-operative complication rates.

interventions.name: Clear Liquids
interventions.description: Participants will not take anything by mouth after midnight the day before surgery but will be given 12 ounce clear liquid (Sugar-free Gatorade) at bedside at the pre-operative holding area

interventions.name: Standard of Care
interventions.description: Participants will not take anything my mouth after midnight day before surgery

primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At time of intubation (about 1 hour after fluid intake)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with observed emesis
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During perioperative period which includes preoperative, intraoperative and post operative time (about 4 hours)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with subjective pre-operative nausea
Number of participants with subjective post-operative nausea
Number of participants with production of oropharyngeal secretions
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: During the perioperative period which includes preoperative, intraoperative and post operative time (about 4 hours)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with wound dehiscence
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: postoperative follow up appointment (about 1 month after surgery)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants with intraoperative complications
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From start of surgery to end of surgery

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Amount of post-operative pain medications needed
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at first clinic appointment (about 1 month after surgery)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Overall patient satisfaction as assessed by the Press-Ganey Questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: This is a 10 item questionnaire and each is scored from 1(very poor) to 5(very good) , maximum score of 50 a higher number indicating better outcome

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy during the day or night of a weekday (including those consented on a Friday who get postponed to a weekend surgery start time).
* Modified rapid sequence intubation (mRSI)

Exclusion Criteria:

* History of reflux disease
* History of hiatal hernia
* History of esophageal disease
* History of gastroparesis
* Known history of difficult airway or planned fiberoptic intubation
* HbA1c greater than 12
* Pregnant women
* Prisoner
* Procedures conducted on weekends and holidays
* Emergency or non-elective procedures
